data.title: Time and Height
data.statement:
Bob is a mischievous child who likes to experiment by throwing objects <<vertically>> up into the air at different speeds and catching them again. Given a list of [[object]]s and the respective [[speed]]s with which Bob throws them, output:

  1. the object that falls back down the fastest (along with its time), and
  2. the object that reaches the highest altitude (along with its height).

Air resistance is negligible. Assume the acceleration due to gravity to be {{-9.8 m/s²}}.

<<Hint:>> You are given the equations {{s = ut + 0.5at²}}.
Where:
{{s}} is the displacement,
{{u}} is the initial velocity,
{{a}} is the acceleration, and
{{t}} is the time elapsed.

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read object:word(100) initialVelocity:float
write fastest_object_to_fall time
object_with_highest_altitude height
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer: [[N]]
<<Next [[N]] Lines:>> A string and a float separated by a whitespace: respectively the object and the speed (in m/s) which Bob throws it with.
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> The [[<<object>>]] which falls back down to Bob's height the fastest and the [[<<time>>]] (in seconds) <<rounded to 2 decimal places>>.
<<Line 2:>> The [[<<object>>]] which reaches the highest altitude and the [[<<height>>]] (in metres) <<rounded to 2 decimal places>>.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Bob is a mischievous child who likes to experiment by throwing objects vertically up into the air at different speeds and catching them again. Given a list of objects and the respective speeds with which Bob throws them, output the object that falls back down the fastest and the object that reaches the highest altitude.

Air resistance is negligible. Gravitational acceleration as -9.8 m/s2.

Hint: You are given the
suvat
formula s = ut + 1/2 at^2.
Where:
s is the displacement,
u is the initial velocity,
a is the acceleration, and
t is the time elapsed.
Input
Line 1: An integer: N
Next N Lines: A string and a float separated by a whitespace: respectively the object and the speed (in m/s) with which Bob throws it with.
Output
Line 1: The object which falls back down to Bob's height the fastest and the time (in seconds) rounded to 2 decimal places.
Line 2: The object which reaches the highest altitude and the height (in metres) rounded to 2 decimal places.
Constraints
0 < speed < 40
The strings itself will contain no whitespace, only letters.
Example
Input
1
Sharpener 36.041209
Output
Sharpener 7.36
Sharpener 66.27
